She qualified her first loan with Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), in the amount of KES 30,000, which she plans to use to purchase more clothes, shoes, necklaces, and earrings. 

She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hope and dream is to buy her own plot.

loans.use: to purchase for more stocks of clothing.

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur 34 years old, married and has two children. His family live in the house which the state has given them as refugees. Eight years ago, Zaur has started his own business. Previously, he worked at a school as a master but his salary did not allow him to fully maintain the family's needs. 

After remembering the skills taught to him by his father, he decided to open his own workshop. Now he repairs vehicles. In addition, in front of the garage he wants to open a teahouse. So far, his clients are served tea in the workshop which creates some discomfort for him and his customers. For this reason, he has applied for a loan in the amount of 700 AZN. With the teahouse separated from the workshop, he can confidently and without hesitation continue his work with quality and professionalism to repair the machine.

loans.use: to separate the tea-house from workshop.

loans.name: Aleksi

texts.en:
Aleksi, 64, is from the village of Ruisi. He lives with his wife, daughter, son-in-law, three grandchildren, and retired mother. Aleksi has a fruit and vegetable business, and owns a stall at the local open market. He says that he has many regular customers, which gives him a good income. He is a very hardworking man, with a great desire to ensure his family members with proper living conditions. 

Aleksi has requested this loan to purchase a van and use it in making product deliveries. Aleksi will continue his trading business and reduce transportation costs. He will generate good income to satisfy the daily needs of his family members.

loans.use: to purchase a van and use it in making product deliveries.

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits and processes bill payments. She lives in Serang, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Eka is married.

Eka began working with Ruma five months ago because she wanted to increase her income and business by selling mobile airtime and servicing bill payments. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, she has had around $46 - $50 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

Recently, she took a loan for getting a printer from Kiva to support her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: to purchase a printer to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Jhunu

texts.en:
Jhunu is a 47-year-old woman living with her husband, son and daughter in a small village of Odisha, India. She has been engaged in the activity of selling bangles at a nearby market for the last two years.

She is planning to open a ladies’ cosmetics variety store, and for that, she needs some financial help. She hopes it will be very helpful to earn some more income so she can manage her family's expenses smoothly.
 
She has requested a loan amount of 10,000 INR (Indian rupees) for purchasing cosmetic items and new designs of bangles, so she can increase her customer base. She wants her son to complete his graduation from a good college and to save some money for her daughter’s marriage.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic items and new designs of bangles.

loans.name: Odmaa

texts.en:
Odmaa is 50 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling jewellery to local people at the trade center since 2002. Her husband has a disability and gets a state pension. Their daughter goes to high school and their eldest son studies at university in China. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some serious repair. So she is requesting a loan of 8000000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, fibreglass and foam to renovate her house. As a result, her family will live in comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into atmosphere.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim (pictured above), age 51, is a lotus farmer. He has five daughters and three sons. Two of his children are garment workers, two graduated their degrees and have no work yet, and the other four attend school.
  
Sim asked for a loan to buy a motorbike for his children who are garment workers to drive to work. Because they don’t have their own transportation, they spend lots of money on the costs of the journey.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for his children to get to work.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
El señor Faustino  de   61  años de edad , vive con su esposa, no tiene  hijos  que dependen de él,  vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 10 años  a la venta de abarrotería, frescos, verduras y también vende carne de cerdo.
Don Faustino también se dedica a la construcción, tiene apartamentos de alquiler  y sus clientes son los amigos, vecinos y personas que transitan por la carretera que lleva hacia el hospital, es una buena zona en donde tiene el negocio porque tiene muy buena clientela, el es bien trabajador y futurista y su deseo es mejorar.
Don Faustino está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de  manteca, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, salsas, pastas, sal, pan, galletas, etc. y también para realizar unas mejoras a su vivienda, con el apoyo de este crédito espera mejorar sus ingresos y su negocio , está muy contento de seguir trabajando con Prisma. Su sueño es construir más cuartos para alquiler.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Faustino, 61, lives with his wife and has no dependent children.  He lives in southern Honduras in the community of San Lorenzo, Valle.  He owns his house and for the last ten years has worked selling groceries, soft-drinks, vegetables and pork.

Faustino also works in construction.  He has apartments that he rents and his customers are friends, neighbors and people who are traveling on the highway to the hospital.  His business is located in a good zone because he has many customers.  He’s very hardworking and forward-looking and his wish is to improve.

Faustino is asking for a loan to buy shortening, rice, sugar, beans, sauces, pasta, salt, bread, cookies, etc. and also to do some home improvements.  With this loan’s support he hopes to increase his income and improve his business.  He’s very happy to continue working with Prisma.  His dream is to build more rooms to rent.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - September, 2013.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
María, ve que si administra muy bien los créditos que se le otorganobtiene un negocio más sólido, ganancias mayores a las que tenía antes. Ella ha decidido a invertir nuevo capital en la compra de cerdos y comida para alimentarlos.
La calidad de vida familiar que hoy les ofrece a sus hijos es mucho mejor, tienen mejor alimentación, su nivel educativo ha mejorado.
María persevera por conseguir su meta de mantener su negocio y mejorar día con día la situación de hogar.
texts.en:
María sees that if she very well manages the loans she’s granted her business will be more solid thanks to the higher profits she earns compared to before.  She’s decided to invest new capital in the purchase of pigs and in feed for them.

The quality of life she offers her children  is much better now; their nutrition is better and their level of education has risen.  

María perseveres in order to reach her goal of staying in business and every day improve her situation at home.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is married and has four children. She buys and sells fruits and vegetables, earning PHP 500 a day.

She wants to achieve greater income in order to give a good life to her family, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase a variety of fruits and vegetables, such as cabbages, onions, garlic and tomatoes. 

She hopes through these investments she can provide better living to her family, and operate her business successfully.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits and vegetables, such as cabbages, onions, garlic and tomatoes.

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en: Vanny, 29, is married and the mother of two children who live in a rural village in the Sangke district of Battambang province. Both children are young and attend school. To support the family, she has grown rice for the last 10 years while her husband sells coconuts. Together, they earn about KHR 60,000 a day and save about KHR 10,000 a day to meet their future needs. Vinny has taken out and repaid one previous loan from VisionFund that she used to better support her family. She and her group are applying for a loan, and she will use her portion to buy more coconuts to resell. She hopes to use this loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to resell.

loans.name: Banco Comunal El Milagro Group

texts.es:
EL banco comunal el Milagro está conformado por nueve integrantes, madres solteras con doce  hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracterizan por ser  mujeres trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudieron cursar  una carrera y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. 

Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del banco es Alba y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, ubicada en su casa de habitación, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, jugos, aceite, fósforos, tiste. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal  El Milagro agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "El Milagro" communal bank has nine members - all single mothers with a total of twelve children in their care.  The women are originally from Sauce, in the west of the country.  The members are hard-working, responsible, and have a desire to overcome all obstacles.  Unfortunately they were not able to study at university and were obliged to work from a young age, in order to help with household costs.

Thanks to her spirit and her desire to get ahead, Alba, the communal bank's coördinator, has a grocery store that she runs out of her home.  The grocery store sells consumable products, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, juices, oil, and matches, in small quantities.  Alba works selling her products some twelve hours every day.  This loan will be used to invest in working capital and to stock up her business. With this, in the not-too-distant future, Alba will be able to earn a higher income.  The "El Milagro" communal bank is grateful to Kiva lenders for providing people with little resources and poor countries, such as Nicaragua, with the opportunity to have a decent job.

loans.use: to stock up her grocery store with products such as rice, beans, rice, milk, bread, eggs, juices, oil, and matches.

loans.name: Sal

texts.en:
Sal, age 51, is a farmer. She lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh and has seven children. Her husband is a construction worker.
Sal’s husband wants to change business from construction worker to become a Moto-Kang-Bei driver. In the past, they were commonly known as "Tuk- Tuks" (a three wheeled motorcycle taxi), but they are now officially called "Moto-Kang-Bei" by government authorities. Hence Sal decided to apply for a loan to buy a Kang-Bei for her husband.

loans.use: To buy a Moto-Kang-Bei for her husband.

loans.name: Dar West Group

texts.en:
Safari, who is in his early 30s, is married with three children, one of whom goes to school and the other two are still young. Safari has been running a general store for two years now. He works from 7.00 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Safari's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to install electric power in his business shop and also restock the missing items in his shop. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to renovate his house by painting the whole house. He will use this loan to restock the missing items in his shop inventory and to also buy an electronic money transfer machine. He dreams of owning a bar or a grocery store.

Safari will share this loan with his loan group "Dar West" with eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in his shop inventory and to also buy electronic money transfer.

loans.name: Mighty Angel

texts.en: Mighty Angel is 25 years old, married and full of dreams for the future of her children. She earns a living by selling cell phone accessories and motor parts and uses her income to improve her family's daily life. She also was able to extend some financial help to her parents. Now she is requesting a loan for PHP 30,000 to invest in her business. She will use this money to buy motor parts and cell phone accessories to sell. She hopes to earn higher income to provide for the financial security of her business and her family.

loans.use: to buy motor parts and cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a mother of five children and married to a farmer. She is now 61 years old, yet still hopes for greater income someday. Her youngest child still attends school in college. With her husband, they plant various kinds of fruits such as bananas, pineapples, and vegetables. She also offers these within their village. 

Other than fruit and vegetables selling, she has also managed a general store for 40 years now. In this regard, she would like to ask for a loan to buy stocks of various merchandise for her general store like canned goods, candies, noodles, condiments, and more. She knows that through this additional capital and her hard work, her family will somehow get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy stocks of various merchandise for her general store like canned goods, candies, noodles, condiments, and more.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Dora, vive con sus hijos uno de 12 y 6 años, es madre soltera y es el pilar principal de su casa de ella dependen todo los ingresos. 
Trabaja de forma independiente en su venta de tortillas, oficio que aprendió de su familia;inicia su actividad a las 9:00 a.m. y la finaliza a las 4:00 p.m., con el préstamo comprara maíz y leña para la elaboración de las tortillas. Su negocio no representa ninguna dificultad.
Lucha por mejorar su negocio, tener mayores utilidades, cubrir las necesidades de su hogar  y darles a sus hijos la oportunidad de superarse para enfrentar las dificultades que ella a tenido que pasar.
texts.en:
Dora lives with her children, a 12-year-old and a six-year-old.  She’s a single mother and her home’s main support; everyone depends on her income.

She works independently selling tortillas, an occupation she learned from her family.  She starts her workday at 9am and ends at 4pm.  She will use the loan to buy more corn and firewood to make tortillas.  Her business presents no difficulties.

She strives to improve her business, to net higher profits, to cover her home’s needs and to provide her children with the opportunity to improve themselves so they can face the difficulties she’s had to go through.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas.

loans.name: Oscar Mauricio

texts.es:
Oscar, nuevamente invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abono, semilla e insecticidas) para la siembra. Con el préstamo anterior el mejoro su cosecha, aumentaron sus ingresos. En el cultivo a Oscar no se le ha presentado dificultades ha sabido aprovechar el apoyo que se le dio.
Las necesidades que él tenía poco a poco las ha cubierto, pues su vivienda ha sido mejorada, tienen acceso a mejor salud lo que les permite seguir trabajando, la alimentación es más adecuada y sus hijos están estudiando sin dificultades.
texts.en:
Oscar will once again invest in agricultural supplies (manure, seed and insecticide) for his crops.  With his previous loan he improved his crop yield and his income increased.  Oscar has had no problems with his crops and he’s known how to take good advantage of the support he was given.

He’s covered the needs he had a while ago for he’s improved his house and they have better access to health which makes it possible for them to continue working.  Nutrition is adequate and his children are attending school with no difficulties.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Roda operates a hardware business, selling workshop tools such as pliers, hack saws, nails, and grease among others. She cites price fluctuation as her major challenge.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase nails, paint, timber, and workshop tools for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase nails, paint, timber, and workshop tools for her business

loans.name: Tazeem Group

texts.en:
Tazeem is a 39-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. She is a member of a two-person lending group and requested a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

She wants the financing to invest in buying more equipment for her embroidery business. As this shop is the only source of income for their family, she wants to expand it through this financing and make her life happy. 

She is very experienced and professional in her dealings and has been operating her business for the past six years. In this period, she raised very good services to her clients, as they are happy with her work. 

Tazeem is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them, and bring positive changes in the life of their family.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Maria Fidelina

texts.es:
María, es una madre soltera que lucha por sacar a adelante a sus hijos, vive en casa propia donde también viven sus padres; ellos dependen de los ingresos que ella lleva a su hogar. Dedicada a velar por su familia emprende por cuenta propia la idea de abrir un comedor, donde pondría en práctica su experiencia en la cocina.
Con la inversión comprara aceite, carnes, verduras, mesas y sillas; con lo que brindara un mejor servicio a sus clientes, variedad de platillos y una mejor apariencia a su negocio.
María sueña con hacer crecer sus negocio, tener más clientes nuevos y generar los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los montos de su cuota y así volver hacer uso de un nuevo crédito; pero sobre todo darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María is a single mother who is fighting in order for her children to prosper.  María owns the house where she lives alongside her parents.  Her parents depend on María's income.  Dedicated to looking after her family, María had the idea of starting a small restaurant, where she could put into practice her experience in the kitchen.  

María will use this loan to buy oil, meat, vegetables, chairs, and tables.  With these items she will be able to provide her customers with better service, a variety of dishes, and can give the business a better look.

María dreams of expanding her business, of having more new customers, and of generating the income that she needs to pay off her loan so that she can apply for another loan. However, above all, she wants to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy oil, meat, vegetables, tables, and chairs.

loans.name: Savoern's Group

texts.en:
Savoern, 33 years old, is married, with three children, residing in a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She has three children, two of whom are in school while one is too young for school. 

For the past ten years, she has been farming rice. The current business earns her about KHR 18,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. Savoern has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back her past loans. 

Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Savoern will use her portion to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Enos

texts.en:
Enos is a married man. He is 61 years of age and deals in bee-keeping and sale of honey. He started keeping bees in 1992 with an aim of having a clear source of income. In addition to keeping bees, he also sells milk, which he gets from cows on his personal farm. He says the money he gets supplements his incomes from the bee-keeping business, and this has helped him be able to provide for his family. 

His bee-keeping business is located in a rural area in Bumbaire-Igara in Bushenyi district, and his customers are honey traders from the greater Bushenyi district. 

He would like to use the loan money of  UGX 2,000,000 to buy tins as materials to use in his bee-keeping project, and he hopes that with the profits from the business, his children will get quality education. 

Enos describes himself as a very shrewd person who has seen his business grow from one level to another despite the challenge of weather, which affects his productivity greatly.

loans.use: to buy tins for rearing bees.

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
San, 58, lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She is a married mother of six children, one of whom is still in school. Her family’s income is from planting pineapple. She has been in this business for three years to make a living. From the current business, she can earn about KHR 60,000 per day.

San just joined VisionFund in this cycle. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. 

With this loan, she hopes to extend her farmland to increase her business, so as to earn more income to increase her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Muungano - Beach Group

texts.en:
Aisha, who is in her early 40s, is married with two grown-up children. One is attending university, and another one has finished advanced school level. For five years now, Aisha has been running a business selling fabrics (“vitenge” as known in Swahili). She works from 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. per working day and is able to make a small profit per month. 

This will be Aisha's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use the loan to buy more fabrics to resell to more people. She dreams that one day she will be able to build a nice family house.

Aisha will share this loan with her loan group "Muungano", which totals eight people. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics to resell to more people.

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en:
Diosa is 58 years old, and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Diosa has a business selling personal products in the Philippines; she requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like curtains, bags, and other personal products.

Diosa has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like curtains, bags, and other personal products.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For over four years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women, and curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase fabric and thread for her business. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread for her business

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is asking for a loan because she believes that through it, she will improve her food stall business. 
The previous loan enabled her to save money in her business. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase food ingredients like onions, tomatoes and rice for her business.

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan which, to date, has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients like onions, tomatoes and rice for her business.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, está decidido a solicitar otro crédito por los grandes beneficios que obtuvo y por lo bien que se le atiende,con el capital comprara fertilizantes, abonos y pagara mano de obra, el contratara personas que le ayuden a preparar el terreno, ya que el área de siembra ha aumentado.
Para José los cambios que ha tenido con el crecimiento de su negocio son muchos tales como: mejor cosecha, mayor área de cultivo, mayores ingresos y mejores condiciones de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en: José has decided to request another loan because of the great benefits he got from the previous one and because of the good customer service he receives.  He will use the funds to buy fertilizer, manure and to pay labor costs for he’ll hire people to help him prepare the land because his acreage has increased.  The changes José has had in his business are many, among which are: improved harvest, larger acreage, increased income and better living conditions for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Saophea's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Cheung Prey district, Saophea is 34, and married with four children, two of whom are still in school. 

She and her husband earn a living through farming rice. Having been in this business for 15 years, she manages to earn about 27,000 KHR per day and can save about 12,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

This is group loan for Saophea's Group of four females; this is their first loan with VisionFund. 

Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Saophea wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. 

She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
A 49-year-old mother of five children, Sinat resides in a rural village of the Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. To support her living, she has been selling grocery items and also growing vegetables for almost two years. Together, they can earn about KHR 33,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for their future needs.  

This is the second loan for Sinat with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is asking for a loan of 610,000 KHR to buy more vegetable seeds for growing. She hopes to increase her family’s business and gain more income to build some savings to increase her family’s business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetable seeds for growing

loans.name: Kimhun's Group

texts.en:
Kimhun is at the age of 28 years and married with two dependent children. She lives in a rural village of the Banteay Meanchey province’s Mongkul Borey district, earning a living through farming rice, raising cows, and selling grocery items. 

Together, they can earn about KHR 50,000 per day from the current businesses, and can save about KHR 30,000 each day for the future needs.

Kimhun is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes to make more income from her current business to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Inn

texts.en:
Inn, 34, lives with her husband and eight children in a rural village of the Srey Snom district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Inn and her husband grow rice on their farm. Having been in this business for 15 years, Inn earns about 44,000 KHR per day to spend on her family’s needs. 
Inn has never borrowed from VisionFund before this loan. Now she is applying for a loan of 1,900,000 KHR to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She will use a portion of the loan to plow the field. Inn hopes to increase her crop yields so as to generate more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pay for plowing.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Munkhtuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Munkhtuya, 37 years old, lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land. She and her co-worker had worked as cashiers at a supermarket between 1998 and 2008. In 2009, they began their own business by bringing goods from China and supplying them to trade centers. Once a month, they travel to China to get their goods, and later she distributes the goods to clients. 

The house her family lives in has deteriorated over the years, and it needs some serious repair. So, she is requesting a loan of 8,000,000 MNT to install vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors and a low-pressure heater in her house, as well as to insulate her house by purchasing fiberglass and foam. 

As a result, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is used for heating, so that fewer pollutants are released into the air. The burning of coal is the main source of air pollution in Mongolia, according to state research.

loans.use: to install hardwood floors, vacuum-insulated windows and a low-pressure heater.

loans.name: Mariano Antonio

texts.es:
Mariano, busca la oportunidad de invertir más en su negocio de cultivo de granos básicos, comprara fertilizantes, abono, semillas (maíz, frijol, etc.) y preparara el terreno para la nueva cosecha. Con el préstamo que se le dio antes tuvo mejor producción y mayores ingresos.
Hoy Mariano les brinda mayores beneficios a su familia como: mejor educación, acceso a salud y una alimentación que les brida la fuerza y condición para seguir trabajando.
texts.en: Mariano is looking for an opportunity to invest in his basic grains business.  He will buy fertilizer, manure, seeds (corn, beans, etc.) and will prepare the soil for new planting.  With his previous loan he increased crop yields and income.  Today, Mariano is able to provide his family with greater benefits like improved schooling, access to health and nutrition that provides strength and condition to be able to continue working.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married mother of four children, three of whom go to school. She lives in her own house that has electricity but not piped water.

She makes soft drinks and ice cubes using fruits and juice flavors and sells to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase juice flavors and fruits for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase juice flavors and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is married, has three children and resides in Anastacio, Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte. Her husband is a motorcycle driver carrying passengers and baggage while she earns income from food vending. She borrowed 10,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to purchase new tires and accessories for the motorcycle. She wants to improve the general living situation of her family and it motivates her to work hard in faith to increase her returns.

loans.use: to purchase new tires and accessories

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo crédito para invertir en la siembra de granos básico, efectuara la compra de semillas, herbicidas, abono y pagara a las personas que le ayuden a preparar la tierra. Le llena de satisfacción los resultados que tiene al hacer uso de los créditos, pues ha tenido una mayor cosecha y mejores  ingresos.
La familia de José se encuentra muy bien de salud, no han tenido ningún problema les dificulte la realización de sus actividades en el negocio. Con las mejoras económicas han podido ir cancelando sus deudas.
texts.en:
José is asking for a new loan to invest in his basic grains crops.  He will buy seeds, herbicide and manure and will pay people to help him prepare the soil.  The results he gets from using the loans fills him with satisfaction for his crop yields have been greater and so has his income.

José’s family is in very good health; they’ve had no problem that keeps them from doing their business activities.  His improved economic condition has allowed him to gradually pay off his debts.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Chandy

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Chandy is 41 years old and married with four children. She earns a living farming rice to feed and support her family members. To better support her family, her husband buys and sells cows in the village. 

Having been in this business for five years, she is able to earn about KHR 60,000 per day, and manages to save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs. 

Chandy is a first cycle client with VisionFund. Now requesting a loan of KHR 4,000,000, she wants to use it to buy fertilizer for her farmland, and use a portion of it on labor. 

She hopes to increase her rice yield to earn more income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Loum's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Battambang province’s Sangke district, Loum is 35 years old and married with five children; three of whom are in school, while the other two are still small for school. 

She and her husband earn a living through working as construction workers. The current business earns her about 25,000 KHR per day to meet the family needs.
 
This is the first loan for Loum’s group of two members. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, she wants to use her portion to buy construction supplies to support her business and piglets to raise and earn additional income for her family. 

She hopes to feed her pigs to be fat and healthy, and sell them for a good price to improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to support her business and piglets to raise and earn additional income.

loans.name: Noun's Group

texts.en:
Noun is 39 years old and married with four children, three of whom are still in school. Living in a village of the Thmor Koul district, Noun has been farming and selling snacks. Having been in this business for three years, she manages to earn about 50,000 KHR per day to feed her family and children. 
This is the fourth loan for Noun with VisionFund. She completely repaid the past three loans. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Noun is going to use her portion to buy household supplies for her family to use. She hopes this loan will enable her to have enough household supplies for her family.

loans.use: to buy household supplies for her family to use

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Nargiza, 62, lives with her son, grandchild, daughter-in-law, and a sister in the town of Rustavi, close to the capital city of Georgia. 

Nargiza is unemployed at the moment; she stays home and takes care of the family. Nargiza’s son is a security guard and works for a private company; her daughter-in-law is employed at the local municipality, and the sister works at the local nitric factory.  All three get monthly salaries, but the family earnings are modest, and hardly enough to cover food and utilities.
 
Nargiza used to have her own trading business for years, but she stopped it two years ago due to financial problems. The new joint initiative between MFO Credo and Kiva gave her the opportunity to restart the business, and generate income. With the received start up credit, Nargiza will purchase women's lingerie in Byelorussia, and sell the items at wholesale prices. 

She hopes her project will be profitable, as she has the proper experience and old connections with lingerie retailers. 

Nargiza will continue the business and invest the funds in the business to develop it. 

She believes in your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase women's lingerie in bulk and sell at wholesale.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school and one who is an adult. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and house consumables.

For over seven years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase a stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a widowed woman and has seven children, two in school and five grown-ups. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a fish-selling business for the last twenty years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.
 
With the Kshs 10,000 (Kenyan shillings), she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business. She decided to join Yehu to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Eleazar Belarmino

texts.es:
Eleazar, quiere aprovechar la época para cosechar, por lo que se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito  con el que comprara semillas, abono e insecticida y así tener lo necesario para sembrar. Sabe que haciendo buen uso de los préstamos los resultados que tendrá son: un aumento en su producción, satisfacción en  más clientes y mejoraran sus ganancias.
Su familia está siendo beneficiada con mejor alimentación, mejores condiciones de económicas, mayor oportunidad de superación, hasta la fecha él y los miembros de su familia gozan de buena salud.
texts.en: Eleazar wants to take advantage of the planting season which is why he’s decided to request a new loan to buy seed, manure and insecticide to have everything needed for planting on-hand.  He knows that by making good use of the loans his results will be: increased production, more satisfied customers and increased profits.  His family is being benefited by better nourishment, improved economic conditions and greater opportunities for self-improvement.  To date, he and his family members are enjoying good health.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice lives in Buchanan. She is 46 years old and married with six children between the ages of 13 and 32. Four of her children live at home and attend school. For the past three years Beatrice has been selling toothpaste, body cream, bath soap etc. in the local market. She established her business with a loan of LRD 3,000 from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more toothpaste, body cream, bath soap, etc. to expand her business. In the future she wants to build a house and continue expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more toothpaste, body cream, bath soap, etc. to expand her business.

loans.name: Vladimer

texts.en:
Vladimer is from the Marneuli district. He is 34 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two school-age sons. 

Vladimer is, at the moment, unemployed; in fact, the family doesn’t have any source of income. Vladimer has recently returned from Turkey, where he worked as a hired worker, but his earnings were not enough for the family, and Vladimer decided to start a business in his homeland.  That is why he had applied for the credit with MFO Credo.

With the received loan, Vladimer will purchase a secondhand car and service local people as a taxi driver. Vladimer is an experienced and careful chauffeur, and hopes his business will be successful. 

The income of the family will increase and he will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Jose Romeo

texts.es:
José, ha tomado la decisión de hacer una nueva inversión en la siembra de maíz y frijol,necesita el préstamo para comprar abono, insecticida y semilla. Con el capital que se le facilito antes él mejoro su área de cultivo, la producción fue mayor y sus ingresos aumentaron. 
Ahora él puede apoyar más con los gastos que se dan en su casa, las condiciones en las que viven son mejores, tienen como finalidad aumentar cada vez más el área en la que siembran e incluir otro tipo de cultivo para tener mejores ventas
texts.en:
José has decided to make a new investment in his corn and bean crops.  He needs the loan to buy manure, insecticide and seeds.  The capital he got previously improved his land and crop yield was greater as was his income.

He’d now like to better help with household expenses.  Their living conditions are better and their goal is to increase the planted area more each time and to include another type of crop so that his sales will be better.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. He has two children and has been doing this work for 10 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and job salary.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Selling farm produce." His biggest challenge is "watering the crops during drought." Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Raphael was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "for the low interest rate." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "Group savings enables group co guarantee."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?" Raphael replied that it "will provide clean water for domestic use."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Raphael owns the following: "cow, poultry" but does not own "pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household "mosquito net, solar power, TV, DVD," but does not have "electricity, running water, sewing machine."

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Kelyn Jessenia

texts.es:
La  Joven Kelyn   es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su esposo 1 hijo en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  venta  de ropa, desde hace más de 3 años.
Kelyn el préstamo lo necesita para la compra  de  blusas,  vestidos,  pantalones,  chores, faldas, camisas, etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y atender mejor  a sus clientes.
La  Kelyn  espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y  de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en una tienda más grande y reconocido de la zona y que su hijo  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la  sociedad.

Choluteca, Honduras  –  Septiembre  del   2013
texts.en:
Young Kelyn’s a responsible, hardworking, honest person living with her husband and son in southern Honduras.  Her business for the last three years has been selling clothes.  Kelyn needs the loan to buy blouses, dresses, pants, shorts, skirts, shirts, etc.  She hopes the loan will help business sales grow by having more stock on-hand to offer and provide better customer service.

Kelyn hopes to cover her needs and improve her and her family’s quality of life a bit.  She hopes her business will continue growing and in a few years become a larger store that’s well-known throughout the zone and that her son becomes an upstanding citizen with better opportunities in society.

Choluteca, Honduras  –  September, 2013

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Viraksoern

texts.en:
Viraksoern is a rural villager from Takeo Province's Doun Keo district; he is 24 years old, and a teacher. He been teaching for three years; this earns him about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

This is Viraksoern’s first-cycle loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. He wants to specialize in english literature at a local university, so now he is applying for an education loan to cover the entire tuition. 

He hopes this loan will enable him to obtain a higher educational background so that he can get a good job after graduation to support the family.

loans.use: to cover the entire tuition for school

loans.name: Rosa Amada

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con sus  hijos en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  pulpería desde hace más de 18  años.
Doña Rosa el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de manteca, arroz, frijoles, carnes,  café, pan, huevos, leche, etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y poder atender mejor  a sus clientes. 
Doña Rosa espera cubrir las necesidades que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en una de  las pulperías más grande y reconocido de la zona y que sus hijos  y nietos  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la  sociedad.


Choluteca, Honduras  – Septiembre  del   2013
texts.en:
Rosa is a responsible, hard-working, and honest person. She lives with her children in the south of Honduras. For more than 18 years, she has had a grocery store.

Rosa needs the loan to buy lard, rice, beans, meat, coffee, bread, eggs, milk, etc. She hopes that with the loan, sales at her business will increase upon having more product to sell and being able to better serve her customers.

Rosa hopes to meet the needs she has and improve the quality of life a little bit for herself and her family. She hopes that in a few years her business will continue to grow and become one of the largest and most well-known grocery stores in the area, and that her children and grandchildren will become good people with better opportunities in society.

Choluteca, Honduras - September 2013

loans.use: to buy lard, rice, beans, meat, coffee, bread, eggs, milk, etc. for her business

loans.name: Francisco Adan

texts.es:
Francisco, ha tenido una demanda mayor de leña y eso lo hace decidirse a solicitar capital de trabajo para satisfacer a sus clientes.Comprará leña por mayoreo para que su negocio tenga la capacidad de mantenerse activo. Con la ayuda que se le brindo antes las ventas subieron, aumentaron sus clientes y sus ingresos han sido mayores.
Su núcleo familiar se mantiene sin ningún cambio, económicamente están mejor por lo que sus necesidades en gran parte han sido cubiertas. Cada día se esfuerza por ampliar su negocio y atender a clientes nuevos.
texts.en:
Demand for Francisco’s firewood has increased so he’s decided to request working capital to meet customer demand.  He’ll buy firewood at wholesale so his business will have the capacity to remain active.  With the help he got previously, sales and customers increased and so did his income.

His immediate family continues unchanged.  They are better off economically for their needs are met for the most part.  He strives daily to expand business and take on new customers.

loans.use: to buy firewood at wholesale.

loans.name: Jose Inocente

texts.es:
José, opta por un nuevo préstamo para comprar semilla de marañón por mayoreo, para luego asarla y poder ofrecerla a los clientes; con el préstamo anterior su negocio creció, las ventas son mayores, los ingresos aumentaron y con ellos a podido cancelar sus deudas.
Las necesidades de su familia ahora son menos, tienen una calidad de vida mejor, cuentan con los accesorios para procesar su producto, desean seguir trabajando para cumplir los sueños de superación familiar.
texts.en:
José has decided on a new loan to buy cashew nuts at wholesale to roast and sell to customers.  His business grew thanks to the previous loan; his sales are greater, income has risen and he’s been able to pay off his debts with it.

His family’s needs are fewer now and their quality of life is better.  They now have the accessories needed to process the nuts and want to continue working to reach their dream of family improvement.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts at wholesale.

loans.name: Binta

texts.en:
Binta is 50 years old, married, and has six children between the ages of 12 and 30 years old. Only two live with her in the community surrounding Airport. She did not attend school, but she is good at managing her home and business. 

Binta has been running a cook shop (restaurant) for the past five years in the local market and she learned this way of selling from her mother. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase vita, bitter ball, oil, pepper, rice, dried bush-meat, and fish for her cook shop (restaurant). She likes her business because her daily sales are high. Her plan is to build a standard restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase vita, bitter ball, oil, pepper, rice, dried bush-meat, and fish for her cook shop (restaurant).

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.en:
Isidoro age 59, is a certified organic farmer from the beautiful village of San Jose, Toledo District, southern Belize. He and his wife Modesta, raised seven children, all living out and employed; some by the Belize Defense Force and some are teachers. 

Isidoro is excited about working on the farm as he sees income from his cacao sales, he enjoys harvesting and selling his production. The income from his sales encourages him to expand and properly clean his farm. The previous loan has shown lots of farm management improvement and has recently pruned his cacao trees and is expecting a high yield this coming season.  Isidoro also cultivates other cash crops such as corn, pepitos, beans, ground food etc… 

Isidoro is requesting another loan to assist him in hiring persons to continue to clean his six acres of mature cacao trees.

Isidoro’s future goal is to expand his cacao farm by one more acre.  He then plans to relax and maintain his cacao farm. Isidoro’s hopes are that his children could take over the cacao farm when he retires.

loans.use: To clean 1800 acres cacao

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria lives in the community surrounding Airport, in Margibi County, in Liberia. She is 34 years old and married to a local businessman. They have four children between the ages of 6 and 19. They are in school and live at home. 

Victoria was able to complete 12th grade before starting her business fifteen years ago, selling fish, ice, and cookies in the local market. She sells at her business for eight hours, from Monday to Saturday. She described herself as a hard-working businesswoman. 

Victoria is requesting a loan to purchase more fish, ice, sugar, and flour for her business. Her plans are to build her house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, ice, sugar, and flour for her business.

loans.name: Tanzania Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is in her mid-30s, is married, with one son who goes to school. She has been selling different items in her place, things like ice cream, ice cubes, sodas, juice and cooked food.  She has been in this business for six years now. She works from 9:00 a.m. to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Halima's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy a big fridge for storing more items like juice, sodas, water, etc. She also bought the missing items in the stock inventory. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay for school fees and covered household expenses.  

She will use this loan to buy and open a shop frame for selling items like juice, sodas, ice cream, ice cubes and cooked food.  She dreams of buying land and building a house of her own.

Halima will share this loan with her loan group, "Tanzania", which has a total of seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy and open a shop frame for selling  items like juice, sodas, ice cream, ice cubes and cooked food.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 30 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past four years, Rita has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells plastic items such as plates, cups and basins. 

To help expand her business, Rita has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more plastic items, such as plates, cups and thermoses, to sell and will help Rita to generate greater profits and take care of her child and herself. Rita hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business and add other more different items. 

Rita is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rita who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more plastic items, such as plates, cups and thermoses, to sell.

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
El  señor Félix  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con sus  hijos en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  pulpería desde hace más de 15  años.
Don Félix el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de manteca, arroz, frijoles, carnes, huevos, azúcar, café, harina, pastas, leche, etc.  Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y poder así atender mejor a sus clientes.
Don Félix espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en una de  las pulperías más grande y reconocido de la zona y que sus hijos  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la  sociedad.


Choluteca, Honduras  – Septiembre   del   2013
texts.en:
Félix is a responsible, hardworking, honest person living with his children in southern Honduras.  His business for the last 15 years has been a grocery store.

He needs the loan to buy shortening, rice, beans, meats, eggs, sugar, coffee, flour, pasta, milk, etc.  He hopes his sales will increase with the loan having more merchandise on-hand and being able to provide better customer service.

Félix hopes to cover the needs he has and to improve his and his family’s quality of life a bit.  He hopes his business will continue growing and in a few years become one of the largest, best-known grocery stores in the cone and that his children become upstanding citizens with better opportunities in society.

Choluteca, Honduras – September, 2013

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es:
Hernan trabaja como chofer en una empresa de transporte de su ciudad, lo cual le permite tener ingresos para poder salir adelante.

Hernan está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar fierros para poder colocar protectores en las ventanas de su vivienda ya que hace algunos días casi roban en la vivienda donde habita, así Hernan tendrá mas seguridad en su vivienda y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en: Hernán works as a driver in one of his city’s transportation firms which makes it possible for him to earn income to be able to move forward.  He’s very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve provided him he will be able to buy iron rods to install protective grilles on his house’s windows because a few days ago his house was almost burglarized.  In this way, Hernán will have more security at home and he will continue striving to reach his great dream: to own a house.

loans.use: to buy iron rods.

loans.name: Santos Rosalio

texts.es:
El  señor  Santos  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive   con sus hijos y esposo  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la venta  de refrescos  y  churros  desde hace más de 6 años.
Don Santos el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de refrescos, jugos,  y churros, aguas, etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y poder así atender mejor  a sus clientes.
Don Santos espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno de  los  negocios más grandes y reconocido de la zona y  seguir  apoyando que sus padres e hijo  ya  que  son de  escasos recurso  económicos.


Choluteca, Honduras  – Septiembre   del   2013
texts.en:
Santos is a responsible, honest, and hard-working person. He lives with his children and spouse in the south of Honduras. His business is in selling drinks and churros, which he has done for over six years.

Santos needs the loan to buy drinks, juice, churros, water, and other items. With this loan, he hopes that sales will increase in his business due to having more products to offer and being able to better attend to his customers.

Santos hopes to take care of necessities and improve his and his family's quality of life a bit. In a few years, he hopes that his business keeps growing and becomes one of the largest and most recognized businesses in the area. He also wants to continue supporting his parents and child because they lack economic resources.

Choluteca, Honduras—September 2013

loans.use: to buy drinks, juice, churros, water, and other items for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools such as wheelbarrows and wood, among others

loans.name: Dora Maribel

texts.es: Dora, tiene 40 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y vive con ellos y su esposo en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Dora trabajaba en una empresa privada y luego de quedar sin empleo ha decidido dedicarse a vender mercadería como ropa, adornos, bisutería, piñatas, y artículos de segunda mano. Hace siete meses que inicio esta actividad y ya tiene sus clientes fijos. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 7,000 lempiras para surtir de mercadería como ser ropa para bebes y ropa de cama como sabanas y cubre colchones, con el propósito de incrementar el inventario y sus ingresos. Ella tiene como plan poner una tienda de novedades.
texts.en:
Dora, 40, is married and has two children. She lives with them and with her husband in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes.  Dora was employed in a private firm but when she lost her job she decided to start selling merchandise like clothes, decorations, costume jewelry, piñatas and second-hand items.  She started this activity seven months ago and already has regular customers.

She’s requesting a loan for 7,000 Lempiras to stock up on merchandise like infant wear and linens like sheets and mattress covers to increase inventory and income.  Her plan is to open a variety store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es: Domingo, tiene 54 años de edad, es casado, tiene 6 hijos y vive con su familia en una aldea del Níspero, Santa Bárbara. El siempre se ha dedicado al cultivo de granos básicos de maíz y frijoles. Y hace 5 años comenzó con su finca de café, el cual vende en su misma comunidad. Ha mantenido esta actividad mediante la inversión de varios prestamos, con el préstamo actual son tres ciclos y es por 20,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento a su finca de café. Su plan es seguir ampliando la finca y poderle dar mejor condición de vida a su familia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en: Domingo, 54, is married and has six children. He lives with his family in a village in Níspero, Santa Bárbara.  He’s always worked growing basic grains like corn and beans but five years ago started growing coffee that he sells in his own community.  He’s kept this activity up with the help of several loans.  The current one will be his third and it’s for 20,000 Lempiras he’ll use to buy fertilizer for coffee crop maintenance.  His plan is to continue expanding the farm to provide better living conditions for his family and so his children may become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Alejandro Amadeo

texts.es:
Alejandro es un joven de 22 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Nazca y se dedica a trabajar en su cultivo de cochinilla, al cual le dedica alrededor de 8 horas al día, Alejandro cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy dedicado y le gusta lo que hace.

Alejandro está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes para las platas de tuna en donde se cultiva la cochinilla, de esta manera podrá tener una buena cosecha y mejorar su calidad de vida, así seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Viajar a otro país”.
texts.en:
Alejandro’s a young 22-year-old living in the city of Nazca who works growing cochineal.  He spends about 8 hours daily at it and he believes he does well in business because he’s dedicated and enjoys what he does.

Alejandro is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve provided he will be able to buy manure and fertilizer for his cactus plants that the cochineal grows on.  In this way, he’ll have a good harvest and his quality of life will improve.  He will thus continue striving to make his great dream reality: to travel abroad.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Luisa Fernánda

texts.es: Luisa  a sus 19 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, vendiendo productos por catálogo. Esta actividad la conoció por medio de una amiga que la invitó a una conferencia de una empresa que ofrece alimentos por catálogo, pero ella no le vio potencial a esa revista, por lo que decidió comenzar con la venta de productos de belleza y hasta el momento ha tenido muy buenos resultados, de esta manera genera los recursos necesarios para aportar a la economía de su hogar. La cliente es una joven activa, emprendedora y pujante, tiene un espíritu de superación que la motiva a buscar opciones que le permitan salir adelante, es por esto que solicita el crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor (perfumería, cosméticos, accesorios, productos de aseo personal, entre otros), para aprovechar los descuentos y las promociones que le ofrecen y abastecer su inventario para la temporada navideña, con más variedad de artículos que satisfagan las necesidades y gustos de sus compradores. Esto se reflejará en el incremento de sus ventas y afectará directa y positivamente sus ingresos personales, con los que podrá  continuar avanzando hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es montar un almacén de mercancía, que sea rentable y reconocido en el sector y que le permita disfrutar en un futuro, de una estabilidad económica y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luisa, 19, makes a living as an independent vendor by selling products from a catalogue. She found out about this work from a friend who invited her to a conference of a business that sells food from a catalogue. However, Luisa didn't see potential in that publication, so she decided to start selling beauty products and so far she's had very good results. This work allows her to earn the income she needs to pay household expenses.

Luisa is young, active, enterprising, and thriving. She has an attitude of overcoming obstacles and she has the motivation to look for ways she can move forward. This is why she is requesting this loan to buy wholesale merchandise such as perfume, cosmetics, accessories, personal hygiene products, and more. Then she can improve the discounts and promotions they offer and stock up her inventory for the Christmas season with a larger variety of items to satisfy her customers' needs and tastes. This will be reflected in increased sales and will positively and directly affect her personal income. With this extra income, she can keep moving forward and achieve her primary goal of opening a store for merchandise that will be successful and recognized in the area. This will also allow her to enjoy the future with economic stability and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise such as perfume, cosmetics, accessories, personal hygiene products, and more.

loans.name: Katherine Julissa

texts.es:
Katherine es un joven que trabaja como cajera en un centro recreativo de su ciudad, en el cual trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día, asimismo tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de zapatos y ropa con lo cual tiene un ingreso extra;  ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es  muy responsable y carismática con los clientes.

Katherine esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería para su pequeño negocio como zapatos, así seguirá luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Katherine is a young woman who works as a cashier at a recreation center in the city. She works around eight hours a day there, and she also has a small business selling shoes and clothing to make extra income. She thinks it's going well because she is very responsible and charismatic with her customers.

Katherine is grateful for Kiva loans because with their help, she will be able to buy merchandise such as shoes for her small business. This will help her to keep working toward her dream of having her own home.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina, age 50, is from Rustavi town where she lives with her husband and two school-age children. Irina is a housewife at the moment. She used to run a clothes trading business, and has ten years of experience in this field. But nowadays she stays at home as the family doesn't have enough resources to purchase stocks of merchandise to restart a predetermined activity. The only one who earns money in the household is Irina’s husband who is a bus driver and gets a monthly salary.

She has applied for this loan in order to purchase a supply of clothing and linens at wholesale prices in Turkey, where the prices are lower than in Georgia, and then sell the items from her own kiosk, located in front of her house. 

She will be very nice to her customers and do her job with love and care. Irina will be able to get more profits and make savings to satisfy the everyday needs of her family members. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and linens for resale.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Please meet 35-year-old Fatu from Liberia, to be preside. She lives in the community surrounding Airport. She is married with 7 children between 2 and 10 years old who live at home and attend school.

For the past two years, she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and learned this ways of selling from her mother. She sells from Monday to Saturday, spending 7 hours per day on her business. She is appreciative of her business because it keeps her saving money every day. Her plans are to build a house and become a rich woman. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She would like to thank BRAC Liberia for their continuous support.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en:
John Bosco is a 48-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is bar business, but he also practices agriculture as his side income in order to earn additional income. 

He has the hardship of high prices of products, however, his vision is to expand his business to trade in wholesale.

John Bosco intends to use the loan to buy crates of soda and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy crates of soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Aletha

texts.en:
Aletha is 49 years old and lives in Airport Community.  She is married, with six children between 11 and 26 years. Among her six children, only three live at home and attend school. 

For the past four years she been selling rice, red oil, salt, etc., in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She like her business because it keeps her busy. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, red oil, salt, etc., for her business.

Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, red oil, salt, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Gëzim

texts.en:
Gëzim, 26 years old, is single, and he lives in the southern part of Kosovo with his entire family. Gëzim works as waiter in a pizzeria restaurant. 

A few years ago, his family started to build an annex on their house because it was so small. Although they were able to complete the construction, they were not able to get the electricity installed because the money Gëzim generates through his work is not enough. 

For this reason Gëzim is requesting a loan to pay for the installation of electricity and finally complete the renovation of his house. He  hopes that the loan will improve his family's standard of living and make life easier for him and his family. 

He is very appreciative of this help and promises to make his payments punctually.

loans.use: To install the electricity in his house

loans.name: Remzije

texts.en:
Remzije is the mother of five children between the ages of 5 and 12 years old.  The family lives in a village in the southern part of Kosovo. 

Remzije is involved in the traditional agricultural business of owning a cow, and her husband works in construction in a private company, earning a very small salary. She uses the cow's milk for her family and also sells milk and other dairy products from the cow in her neighborhood. 

Remzije needs to renovate her stable, which is very old, so she is requesting a loan for this purpose. 

Remzije is a very hard-worker, and she works a lot to have a better life for her family. Her goal is to improve her situation to offer her family a better life. 

In the future, she plans to increase the number of cows she owns.  Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, she wants to thank all the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To renovate her stable, which is very old

loans.name: Hanishe

texts.en:
Hanishe is 46 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the southern part of Kosovo. Her husband works in construction and is a very hard-worker with a low salary. 

She is a seamstress, operating a business from her home. She has enjoyed much success in this career as over the past 15 years she has been able to acquire a lot of satisfied customers. 

She is now requesting a loan in order to buy material for her work so that she can achieve her goal.  That is to improve the living conditions of her family and to save money toward her children's education. 

She is hoping in the future to expand her business more and to have a shop for her work. She really appreciates this help!

loans.use: To buy material for her work

loans.name: Munavara

texts.ru: Мунавара родилась в 1969 года. Она не замужем и живет с матерью. Она инвалид. Мунавара не смотря на трудности здоровья, уже более 13 лет работает в средней школе и занимается воспитанием и обучением детей. Она поступила в Педагогический Университет, чтобы получить высшее образование и повысить свою квалификацию. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор и с такой целью она обратилась за займом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Munavara was born in the year 1969. She doesn't have a husband and lives with her mother. She is disabled. Munavara, despite the difficulties with her health, has more than 13 years of work experience in high school education, raising and educating children. She graduated from the Pedagogical University, to get a secondary education and to increase her qualifications. She needs to pay her student fees and for this purpose she applied for a loan. She is requesting a loan for the sum of 2500 Somoni. She waits on your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz is the widowed father of two boys, living in a southern part of Kosovo in a small village about 20 km outside the city. 

Aziz provides transportation services.  He uses his van to transport his neighbors since he lives in a village where there is no bus service. As he has been in business for 12 years, his business and client base have grown steadily.  He has a good reputation in the community, where he works hard to improve their living conditions. 

Recently his van broke down, and Aziz was unable to work and generate income. He is requesting a loan to pay the costs of repairing his van and the labor needed. 

He is grateful to all Kiva lenders and will continue to work hard to grow his business.  He really appreciates this help!

loans.use: To pay the costs of repairing his van and the labor needed

loans.name: Burim

texts.en:
Burim is 43 years old and married, with three children between the ages of 10 and 21 years old.  He lives in the southern part of Kosovo. His wife is a seamstress and she works from her home, which allows her also to take care for the house and children. 

Burim offers his services as a taxi driver and is a very hard-working, serious, and responsible. He has been running this business for more than seven  years, starting out working only half days and now working full time. 

He is very fortunate to be living in the only city in Kosovo where taxi drivers have permission to transport passengers to and from the airport, adding much needed income for his family, as his is the main source of income for them. 

Burim has been working for so long that his vehicle now needs some repairs and to register his taxi with current permits. He has not been able to save the money because of the money and resources it requires to support his family’s needs, so he is requesting a loan to do general repairs to his vehicle. 

This loan will help him to continue his business and to improve his family's living conditions. He wants to thank all of the lenders!

loans.use: To do general repairs to his taxi vehicle

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Adama. She is married and has two children, ages 11 and 14. Two of her sisters live with her to get assistance with their schooling. 

In 2000, Adama established her cosmetics and provisions business. She began her business at the age of 20 when she became pregnant.  Her parents told her to go to the man who impregnated her, and in the end, the man decided to give her substantive capital to establish her own business so that she could get help for some domestic issues. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 850,000 every month from this business. 

Adama requires a loan in order to buy goods worth SLL 3,000,000. She is grateful for her past loan because of the increase in her profit margin from Le 500,000 to Le 850,000, though her plans to become the leading agency are still in progress.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy some cosmetics and provisions to add to her business.

loans.name: Santiago Amador

texts.es:
Santiago tiene 38 años de edad, trabaja como ayudante en una ferretería de su ciudad y con los ingresos de su humilde trabaja puede solventar los gastos de su hogar, ya que es padre de 3 hijos.

Santiago está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar una cocina a gas ya que actualmente cocina en una de kerosene y se encuentra en mal estado, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir  luchando por hacer realidad su sueño:” estudiar la carrera de mecánica”.
texts.en:
Santiago is thirty-eight years old and works as an assistant in a hardware store in the city where he lives.  With the income he makes in his humble work, he is able to cover the home expenses.  He is the father of three children.  

Santiago is thankful to the Kiva investors.  Thanks to the help that they have offered him, he is able to buy a gas stove.  He presently cooks with a kerosene stove that is in bad condition.  Buying a new gas stove will allow him to improve the quality of life for his family, and to continue fighting to make his dream come true, which is to become a mechanic.

loans.use: to buy a gas stove.

loans.name: Valbone

texts.en:
Valbone is 29 years old, married, and the mother of five children between the ages of 5 and 10 years old. She lives in the southern part of Kosovo. 

For the past 13 years she has been making and selling handicraft items to local customers in order to earn a living. She really enjoys her work but now she will also do some seamstress work to add additional income to the family, as her husband continues to work in the agricultural business keeping and tending his livestock. 

Valbone now is requesting a loan through KosInvest to buy a sewing machine. She hopes to earn a higher income by adding the seamstress business and hopes to expand her business in the future. 

She is happy for the financial support from KosInvest because it helps her to secure a stable future for her family.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Sali

texts.en:
Sali, 40  years old, is a married man who lives in the Roma community.
