In this community, it is traditional for people to play musical instruments at weddings and other celebrations for fees in order to make a living. Sali has been doing this for long time.  In the summer, which is a popular time for people to get married, he is able to generate much business and is well paid. 

Sali lives in a home that has suffered much damage from winter weather, and as his business is slow during that time of the year, he was unable to save the money for the renovations or fix it immediately.  

Sali is requesting a loan so that he can change the doors and windows so that he can improve his living conditions and have a better life.

His future goal is to expand his band and add new musicians and instruments in order to have more income and appeal to a wider audience and needs.

He really appreciates this support and is very grateful for the financial support given to him to help his family.

loans.use: To change doors and windows to repair winter damage to his house.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 33 years old and married, from a small village near Nablus city. She is a mother with two sons.

For the past five years, Hanan and her husband have operated a small grocery store in the city, where they sell basic products like suger, rice, and dairy milk. 

Hanan has requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to improve the grocery store she and her husband own by buying more products to resell. This will increase their income and also the family's living conditions.

Hanan appears in the photo

loans.use: to improve her grocery store by buying more products to resell

loans.name: Ramadan

texts.en:
Ramadan is 59 years old, widowed, and the father of a 23-year-old daughter. He is living in a Roma community. 

Ramadan works in a library and has had a very difficult life, especially as his wife died six years ago, leaving him to care for their daughter, who has been disabled since the age of 17, unable to walk. He always tried to save some of the money from his salary to pay the doctors and is hoping that one day she will walk. 

For this reason he is requesting a loan in order to pay for treatment and medications for her. This loan will help him to reach his dream of seeing his daughter in good health and continue a normal life. He really appreciates this help!

loans.use: To pay for treatment and medications for his disabled daughter

loans.name: Rijad

texts.en:
Rijad is 25 years old, recently married, and the father of one baby boy. He lives in the southern part of Kosovo and works facading buildings and homes in order to make living, but with a low salary. His wife is a stay-at-home mother and takes care of their baby and the home. 

Although Rijad has managed to build a new house, he could not finish the flooring in it, therefore he is requesting a loan. 

Rijad is fortunate that the loan he needs is only to cover the costs of the materials, as he is able to do the labor himself, being that he is in the construction field and able to complete these projects.  

The loan will help him to have a better life, and he is hoping in the future to have his own business doing facades. He wants to thank all of the lenders!

loans.use: To cover the costs to complete his house

loans.name: Eman

texts.en: Eman was born in 1982. She is married and has one daughter. Her husband is a driver. Eman has been selling clothes for one year. She started her business selling a small quantity of clothing at home to her neighbors and friends. Then she started receiving more customers. Eman is planning to open her own independent clothing store in the future. Now she needs a loan to buy a larger quantity of clothes in order to increase her profits and income to cover her daughter’s needs and to support her husband in improving their living conditions. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Cesar Leonardo

texts.es:
César es un señor de 30 años, vive en unión libre hace 8 años con Mónica con quien tiene 2 hijitos,  una niña de 8 y un niño de 6; los dos pequeños se encuentran actualmente estudiando en escuelas públicas.  Viven desde muy corta edad en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad muy comercial de Ecuador, también conocida como la ciudad de puerto de oportunidades ya que es la conexión de las regiones sierra y la costa, y tiene clima cálido húmedo.
Él desde muy joven comenzó a trabajar como maestro albañil para llevar el sustento a su familia, gracias a ese pequeño trabajo poco a poco ha construido su casita en una zona pobre de la ciudad. Su esposa Mónica es ama de casa y se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos.  César quiere mejorar su calidad de vida, por eso desde hace un tiempo atrás ha querido emprender en el negocio de la crianza de pollos ya que cuenta con experiencia porque ayudaba a su hermana quien tiene unos galpones.  Se enteró que en Fundación Alternativa podría plasmar su sueño en realidad gracias al apoyo de Kiva, ya que muchas veces en otras instituciones le cerraron las puertas, es por ello que solicita un crédito para la compra de pollitos, balanceados y para construir un pequeño galpón en el terreno donde vive, de esta manera su esposa también podría ayudarle para mejorar la economía de su hogar. Además luego poder comprarse una moto para repartir sus productos a tiendas y restaurantes del cantón.
Se siente muy agradecido por todo el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
Cesar is 30 years old and has been in a common law marriage with Monica for eight years. They have two children who attend public school, a girl, age 8 and a boy, age 6. They have lived in the Ecuadorian city of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas since they were very young. The city is a commercial center and is often referred to as the “port of opportunity” because it connects the mountains with the coast, and has a warm, humid climate. 

Cesar started working as a master mason at a very young age, in order to support his family. Little by little, his work allowed him to build his own small home in a low-income area of the city. Cesar’s wife, Monica, is a homemaker and she takes care of their children. Cesar says that he wants to improve his quality of life. A while ago he started his own business raising chickens because he had experience from helping his sister with her chicken coops. 

Cesar is requesting this loan from Kiva and the field partner to buy chickens, balanced feed and materials to build a coop on the land where he lives. He says that building there will allow his wife to help him to improve their household finances, too. Cesar also hopes to be able to buy a motorcycle so that he can distribute his products to stores and restaurants in the canton.

Cesar says that other lending institutions closed their doors to him, but he found out that Kiva and the field partner could make his dream a reality, and he feels very grateful for the help he receives.

loans.use: to buy chickens, balanced feed and materials to build chicken coops.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Mumtaz is a 27-year-old married woman and mother of two children. She has had a business of hand embroidery for ten years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to acquire a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy spools of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. Mumtaz dreams for her children's bright future.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Fatheyeh

texts.en: Fatheyeh was born in 1974. She is single and lives with her family in a sector in Jordan called Dair Alla. Fatheyeh has been selling food items for one year. She started her business selling a small quantity of products, then she increased her merchandise slowly. Fatheyeh is planning to expand her business by buying a larger quantity of items in order to increase her profits and income to start supporting her family financially. But she doesn’t have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more food items for resale.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en: Rahima was born in 1965. She is married and a mother of four children. Her husband is retired. Rahima has been selling home products for one year. She started her business using a small amount of money to buy products for resale. Then she started selling products to her neighbors and friends. Now she wants to buy a larger amount of home products in order to attract more customers, and to increase her profits and income to be able to help her husband in covering their children needs. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy home products for resale.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of eight children. For about ten years, she is been in the business of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to build a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers. She dreams to provide better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Yuzda

texts.en: Yuzda was born in 1979. She is married and a mother of two children. Her husband is in the military. She lives with her family in a sector in Jordan called Zarqaa. Yuzda has been selling food items for four months. She started her business selling a small quantity of products, then increased her merchandise slowly. Yuzda is planning to expand her business by buying a larger quantity of food items in order to increase her profits and income to start supporting her husband in improving their living conditions. But she doesn’t have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more food items for resale.

loans.name: Robby

texts.en:
Robby is a 40-year-old micro-entrepreneur who has been running and growing his business for four years.  Robby lives with his wife and two children in the capital city of Zambia, Lusaka. His Zoona mobile money business is the only source of income for the family.  

Robby is requesting a third loan from Kiva.  His first loan was received in October of 2012. The money was used to increase his working capital at his shop, which enabled him to serve more customers and increase his income. With the additional revenue, Robby invested into opening up a second Zoona outlet in the small district of Serenje, located in the central province of Zambia. In May of 2013, Robby took out a second loan with Kiva. This money was used as working capital float for a new shop location in Lilanda compound. This is a highly populated township located in Lusaka. With the help from the two previous Kiva loans, Robby now successfully operates three shops.  

Now, Robby is requesting a loan to increase his working capital at all three business locations. This will enable him to serve more customers and earn additional income. Robby explains that finding access to loans in Zambia as a micro-entrepreneur is difficult. He says he is thankful for the opportunity to obtain working capital through the Kiva lending community. With the additional income, Robby hopes to continue to grow his business and provide for his family.

loans.use: to grow his Zoona money transfer business by adding to his working capital.

loans.name: Ameeneh

texts.en: Ameeneh was born in 1978. She is married and a mother of six children. Her husband works in the media. Ameeneh has been raising and selling goats and chickens for one year. She started her business with a small amount of goats and chickens, then started expanding her business slowly. Now she wants to buy a larger amount of goats and chickens in order to raise her productivity level, in addition to her profits and income, to be able to help her husband in covering their children needs. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more goats and chickens to resell.

loans.name: Zocima Elizabeth

texts.es:
Zocima es una mujer muy trabajadora, se dedica a su pequeño negocio de crianza de ganado y venta de leche, con lo cual puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y sobre todo porque es madre de 2 hijos a quienes ama muchísimo y por quienes lucha cada día.

Zocima está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar una vaca lechera, con lo cual podrá obtener más leche y poder tener mejores ingresos y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:”  Tener un establo, darle una profesión a sus hijos y ser una gran ganadera”.
texts.en:
Zocima is a very hard-working woman.  She makes her living with a small business raising livestock and selling milk.  Through her business, she is able to meet her household expenses.  She is the mother of two children who she loves very much and for whom she works hard every day. 

Zocima is very grateful for the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have offered her, she will be able to buy a dairy cow.  With the cow, she will be able to earn more money and keep working toward making her greatest dream a reality, "to have a stable, to give her children a profession and to be a great rancher."

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maruusi

texts.en:
Maruusi Namigadde is a new borrower, age 35 years old. She is a widow, with three children.

She applied for a loan of UGX.1,500,000 to improve her farming business. She will hire manpower to clear the farmland. 

She has the challenge of little business turnover from her commercial farming and low market prices, so she decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to increase manpower and expand both her farmland and agricultural business.  The reason is to improve her well-being and her children's.

loans.use: To hire labor to clear farmland.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is 23 years old. She lives in a sector of Jordan called Irbid with her husband and three daughters. Hanan is studying for a Bachelor of Finance degree as a fourth year student. She is planning to continue her studies to earn her Masters degree in order to work in her field of study and be able to cover her children's needs. She is currently facing a financial crisis, which is keeping her from being able to pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 24-year-old married woman. She has dealt in the work of milk sales for about eight years. She has three calves and one cow in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. 

Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She is the mother of four children, and she is motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day to day expenses of life.  

It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through its support. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves. 

She hopes to get an increase in the production of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: Manal was born in 1985. She is married and a mother of two children. Her husband is in the military. She lives with her family in a sector of Jordan called Zarqaa. Manal has been selling clothes for one year. She started her business using a small amount of money to buy clothing, then started reselling them. She is planning to open her own store in the future. Currently, she wants to buy more women's clothes to resell in order to increase her profits and income. But she doesn’t have enough money to buy the clothes. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Drita

texts.en: Drita is married and lives with her husband in the southern part of Kosovo where Drita works as a seamstress from her house and her husband works as a taxi driver. She has a lot of customers and is always busy trying to earn a living. She has planned for a long time to renovate her house but she could not manage to save the money. Currently, they live in a house that is in need of renovation. Due to the high cost of electricity, they want to façade their house in order to save costs on heating in the winter. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to pay to façade her house. This loan will help improve their living conditions and save them money on utility costs. Drita is very happy for this opportunity and she thanks all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To renovate the house  to save costs on heating in the winter

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: At the age of 35, Naseem is a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (who is also shown in the photo) for the past year. Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. This is her third year with Kashf Foundation and she has a good credit history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more alcoholic drinks like beer, stout, local gin, God-father-dry-gin, etc., in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Ma-Hawa

texts.en: Ma-Hawa is 49 years old and lives in in the community surrounding Airport with her eight children between the ages of 8 and 29. Only six of her children are in school and live at home. Over the past six years, she has been running a cook shop (restaurant) where she sells delicious Liberian food and cold water. One problem she facing is customer complaints about the high price of food. She makes a lot of profit since she is one of those who prepare a delicious Liberian dish. She started this business with help from her husband who work as security person and she learned this business from her mother. She is requesting a loan to buy more fish, rice, onion, pepper, oil, charcoal, and cold water for her business. Her plans are to educate all of her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more fish, rice, onion, pepper, oil, charcoal, and cold water for her business

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store.  She is a mother of seven children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Fajjan

texts.en: Fajjan is a 45-year-old woman with four children. She has been running a business selling milk with her husband for the past two years. She has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit.  She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. Currently, Fajjan is requesting a loan of 20,000/-through Kashf Foundation to purchase one more cow. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Duaa

texts.en: Duaa was born in 1985. She is married and a mother of three children. Her husband works at a marble factory. Duaa lives with her family in a sector of Jordan called Irbed. Duaa has been selling clothes for one year. She started her business using a small amount of money to buy clothes. Then she started reselling them. Now she wants to buy more women's clothes to resell, in order to increase her profits and income and support her husband in covering their children's needs and improving their living conditions. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina, age 20, is a married woman. She has been running a business purchasing and selling animals for the past two years. She buys baby goats at low prices, raises them and then sells them at the market at higher prices near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). She is in charge of providing her family with bread and butter. In order to purchase two more goats, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation.  She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Matoe

texts.en: Matoe is 50 years old, married and living in the community surrounding Airport in Margibi County, which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She has six children who are between 20 and 35 years old. All of her children are living on their and don't attend grade school. For the past 29 years, she has been involved in business and currently she is selling oil, rice, soap, etc from a small provisions shop. She uses the bus most of the time to get her supplies to her shop. She likes how her customers can buy from her and she enjoys how supportive she is to her family. She learned business from other local businesswomen. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, soap, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, soap, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz is from Iraq.  He is 34 years old, married and father of 2 children.  Aziz works hard to provide for his family and educate his children.

Aziz is a grocer and owns a small grocery store in his neighborhood where he sells snacks, canned food, drinks and ice creams.  He has been providing his family with income through this grocery store since 2000.  Aziz has gained good experience in this field, has a hired an employee and is well-known in the neighborhood.

Aziz is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD.  He will use this loan to renovate his grocery store by installing new blocks on the floor and by repainting the walls of his store.  Aziz believes that by renovating his grocery store, he will be able to attract more customers and thus, increase his profits.  By increasing his profits, Aziz will be able to provide for all the needs of his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store by installing new blocks on the floor and by repainting the walls of his store.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is a 52-year-old woman. She lives with her three children in the Akhaltsikhe district. Her son is a laborer and gets a small monthly income which is not enough for the family. Ruzanna is unemployed now. She decided to request a loan to start her own business. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $300 to start a trading business. She will purchase bed linens to sell among her villagers. The Start Up loan will be a great support for her family as their income will significantly increase.

loans.use: to purchase bed linens for resale.

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en: Asmat is a 57-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and son in the Zugdidi district. Asmat and her husband are unemployed now. Her son works for a local building company and gets 650 Gel per month. There is a high unemployment rate in their region, but self-employment helps locals to make living.  So, she decided to start a business trading clothing with the help of a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Her credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Start-up Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of $200, she will purchase used clothing at wholesale price and sell them in her community door-to-door.  It is obvious that the job is hard for Asmat, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her business gradually. The Start-up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing for re-sale within her community.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia, age 25, is involved in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, raises them and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She is now in her 2nd loan cycle and applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR. This will help her to purchase two more goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Ameeran

texts.en:
Ameeran is 42 years old and has run a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price. She has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

In order to fully stock her store, she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR which she will use to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. This will allow her to regularly meet the increasing demand. She is in her 6th loan cycle with a good credit history. Ameeran hopes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 31-year-old married woman and mother of four. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is a driver. His income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. 

She started her business of sewing clothes to contribute to the family income. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation, and took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. In the present, she enjoys a great client list, and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

Currently, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy a stock of threads, along with packs buttons and needles so she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. 

Nazia is in her third loan cycle, and has shown good repayment behavior. She hopes to grow her business, and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children and improving their standard of living through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads, along with packs of buttons and needles.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is 37 years old.  She is married and the mother of six children. She has been purchasing and raising animals for sale for the last 5 years. Farzana purchases baby cows and goats from the local market at wholesale rates.  She raises them and then sells them to her neighbors and in the local market when they have matured. With her husband's help she is running a successful business to lead them to a decent life. She is working hard to meet her daily household expenses.  

Farzana has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy two more baby goats to expand her business. She hopes to increase her income by targeting more customers. Farzana hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a quality education to her children by working hard in her business.

loans.use: to buy two more baby goats.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 25-year-old Iraqi youth client who is married and has a child. Ali and his wife work together to provide for the family’s living.

Ali owns a shop where he sells oils for vehicle’s engines. He is a very well known retailer in the neighborhood and has an excellent reputation in the surrounding area, thanks to his competitive prices. 

Ali established his business in 2007, and now has an employee hired. 
 
Ali is applying for a youth loan of 2,400 USD. The aim of this loan is to install an external ceiling for his shop and to increase his selling goods. Ali aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he may overcome his current financial difficulties, and provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to install an external ceiling for his shop and increase his goods for sale.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is a 41-year-old married woman.  She lives with her two daughters in the Zugdidi district and is currently unemployed.  

In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants make a living.  Manana decided to start a clothing trading business with the loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers.  Her credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements.  Manana received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo's Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  With the loan of $ 350, she will purchase clothing at wholesale prices and sell them in her community door-to-door.  It is obvious that the job is hard for Manana, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually.  The startup credit will be great support for the family, as their income will significantly increase.  Manana gives her regards to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy clothes to begin trading.

loans.name: Shafiqa

texts.en:
Shafiqa is a 53-year-old married woman who has two children. For about 15 years, she has been working with hand embroidery. Her husband is doing business selling fruits, but his income is not enough to support his family. 

Shafiqa makes beautiful patterns for the people in her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embellishment. In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. 

She is on her fourth loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins, and stones.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 25 years old and lives in Airport community. She completed 12th grade, and she and her fiance are living together. For the past 8 years, she has been selling Lappa (African cloth, mostly used by women), slippers, shoe, etc. in the local market. 

She faces problems, such as goods shortage, since she has little income. She likes her business because it provides for her needs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more Lappa (African cloth, mostly used by women), slippers, shoe, etc. to expand her business. 

Her plan is to build her house and achieve a university degree.

loans.use: to purchase more Lappa (African cloths, mostly used by women), slippers, shoe, etc. to expand her business.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 38-year-old married, vigorous lady, and a mother of a child. She has been stitching clothes for 15 years. She stitches for the people in her community, and uses the income to support her entire family. Her husband is an employee at a local factory, and his income is not enough to cover the family expenditures. 

Due to lack of availability of funds, Shamim is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. 

She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors, with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons, to create means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate healthier source of income. 

She is in her second loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors, with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en:
Zohra, age 41, is married and the mother of five children. She has expertise in hand embroidery.  She has used her skills to provide for her family for more than 10 years. She started in this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. 

Today she is proud to be famous in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. To cope with the increasing demands of her customers, she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase spools of thread with some packs of sequins, glittering material and pearls. She says that the women in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time. Zohra has taken up the challenge of satisfying them.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread with some packs of sequins, glittering material and pearls.

loans.name: Ana Laura

texts.es:
Ana es una joven de 23 años de edad, la cual trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de desayunos, negocio con el cual puede salir adelante y solventar sus gastos de manutención, Ana trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día.

Ana está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar mesas y vitrinas para su negocio y de esta manera mejorar la atención a sus clientes, así seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Ana is a young woman who is 23 years old. She works in her small business selling snacks, a business that allows her to make it through and meet her living costs. Ana works around 10 hours a day and can serve up to 20 customers a day.

Ana is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the help that they have provided she will be able to purchase tables and glass cabinets for her business. In this way she will improve the service to her customers and thus she will continue working to achieve her greatest dream, "to study for a university degree".

loans.use: to buy a glass cabinet and tables.

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and father of two children. Mouhammad works to provide his family while his wife takes care of their children.

Mouhammad owns a small shop where he sells children's clothes and cosmetics. Mouhammad established his business in 2012 and has much experience in this field since he previously worked in a similar shop as an employee. Mouhammad now has a hired employee and an excellent reputation in the neighborhood.

Mouhammad is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to install a display window and signage for his shop, and to buy an air conditioner. Mouhammad is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to install a display window and signage for his shop, and to buy an air conditioner

loans.name: Hashem

texts.en:
Hashem is a hardworking youth client from Iraq. He is 21 years old and lives with his family of 6 members, only one of whom is employed and helping Hashem in providing the family income.

Hashem is a very well known barber. He established his business in 2009, and through practice, he mastered this field. Hashem now has a hired employee and is loved and respected by many, thanks to the special care that he shows his customers.

Hashem is requesting a Youth loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to install a signage for his barber shop and renovate his shop from inside. Hashem hopes that this loan will attract more customers and improve his business in general.

loans.use: to install a signage for his barber shop and renovate his shop from inside.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is from Iraq. He is a youth client 30 years of age who is married and has five children. Ahmad and his eldest child provide the family income together, while his other children continue their studies.

Ahmad owns a garage where he specializes in dyeing vehicles. He has been in this field since 2010 and gained previous experience through working as an employee for several years at a similar garage. Ahmad has good experience in this field and is well-known in the neighborhood since he is the only person with such a service in the surrounding areas.

Ahmad is requesting a youth loan of $1,500. He will use this loan to buy a piece of equipment specialized for his work and to install new shelves in his garage. Ahmad is aiming to continue providing his family with a better standard of living by improving the quality of his work and increasing his profits.

loans.use: to buy a piece of equipment specialized for his work and to install new shelves in his garage

loans.name: Asifa

texts.en: Asifa is a 32-year-old married woman and mother of three children. She works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for 8 years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Asifa was not working, her family was going through severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole bread winner of the family, and due to limited resources, none of their children were sent to school. She felt an obligation to change her family’s living standards and started working. She is a brave woman and her hard work helped her establish a good clientele but she is having difficulty fulfilling large orders. She requested for a loan of 35,000 Pakistani Rupees to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread. Asifa is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. Asifa hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good, quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread.

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es:
María Josefa, tiene 69 años de edad,  es casada, tiene 5 hijos, vive con su esposo en una aldea del Municipio de Choloma, Cortes.
Doña María Josefa , cuenta con una fuente de ingreso que es un negocio de pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como,  harina, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, manteca, medicinas, golosinas, productos de abarrotería, además vende refrescos Big cola al por mayor. Ella esta solicitando otro préstamo a ODEF por 20,000 lempiras para comprar mas productos para mantener surtido el negocio  como ser  manteca, arroz, frijoles, harina, embutidos, lácteos, productos de limpieza y refrescos Para cumplir con la demanda de los clientes.
Su objetivo es incrementar las ventas para obtener mas ingresos  y  lograr tener un nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en:
María Josefa is 69 years old, married and has five children. She lives with her husband in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. María Josefa has a source of income, which is her small store. She sells food products like flour, rice, beans, sugar, lard, medicines, sweets, grocery products besides selling Big Cola soft drinks wholesale.

María Josefa is requesting another loan from ODEF of 20,000 HNL to buy more products to keep her store stocked. She will buy lard, rice, beans, rice, sausages, dairy products,cleaning products and soft drinks to keep up with customer demand. Her objective is to increase her sales to generate more revenue and manage to have a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to stock products like lard, rice, beans, rice, sausages, dairy products,cleaning products and soft drinks.

loans.name: Shahneela

texts.en: Shahneela is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She is a very talented lady and for the past 8 years, has excelled in her work of stitching clothes. She gets a lot of appreciation from her community. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household and the educational needs of children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Shahneela has now requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. With this loan she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand of her regular customers who are her neighbors and the local community. Shahneela hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good, quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 63 años de edad, esta soltera, tiene tres hijo y vive con su hija en el municipio de La Masica, Atlántida. Ella lleva 10 años de  dedicarse a la venta de cosméticos como cremas,lociones, desodorantes,champu ect.la venta la realiza en su casa y entrga a domicilio. El préstamo que solicita es por 7,500 lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de cosméticos como cremas,lociones,esmaltes  y pulseras para la venta. Este préstamo le ayudara a aumentar las ventas y asi poder tener mejores ganancias. Su meta es que con las ganancias del negocio apoyara a sus nietos en la educación.
texts.en:
María is 63 years old, single and has three children. She lives with her daughter in the municipality of La Masica, Atlántida. She has been selling cosmetics like cream, lotion, deodorant, shampoo, etc. for 10 years. She sells from her home and also delivers to other people's homes.

Maria is requesting a loan of 7,500 HNL and will invest it buying cosmetics in order to create more revenue. Her goal is to use the profits to support her grand-children's education.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics like lotions, creams, nail polish, bracelets etc for resale.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 51 years old and lives in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three children. In order to help the family, she sells firewood. Aside from selling firewood, she operates a sari-sari store (general store). She started with capitalization of 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) and was able to expand with the help of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was also able to generate savings and get insurance. 

Now Loida is applying for a 45,000 PHP loan to buy an additional motorcycle for a transport service. This is a new business venture for Loida. Someday she wants to own a mini-mart and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies so that they can help her in the future. 

Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Loida is very thankful because, if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances.

loans.use: to purchase an additional motorcycle

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is 38-year-old married woman and mother of two children. She works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for many years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Rehana was not working, her family was going through severe financial crisis which compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole bread winner of the family and due to limited resources none of their children were sent to school. She felt obligated to change her family’s living standards and started working. She is a brave woman and her hard work has helped her establish a good clientele. She is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders, so she has requested for a loan of 30,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread in various colors. Rehana is in her second loan cycle and hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is a vigorous lady. For the past 10 years, she has been running a cloth sales business. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.  

She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Besik

texts.en:
Besik is 34 years old and lives in a suburb of the capital city, Tbilisi, with his wife. Besik owns a car and serves the locals as a taxi driver to earn a living.

He requested a loan to change his car’s fuel system from petrol to gas, which is cheaper than petrol. This will reduce the cost of transportation by 40 to 45 percent. It will allow Besik to decrease the price of the service, which will attract many customers. Increasing the number of customers and cutting his costs will positively affect his profit. He will pay a local auto service center to change the fuel system. The increased income will be used for his family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to pay for a fuel system change for his taxi.

loans.name: Elvis Manfredo

texts.es:
Elvis, tiene 35 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive con su esposa e hijos en  una aldea cercana al municipio de Choloma, Cortes.
Elvis trabajo en una fábrica maquiladora y al quedar sin empleo decidió establecer su propio negocio por sus propios medios y manejarlo juntamente con su esposa.Se dedica a vender productos de la canasta básica familiar como granos básicos, manteca, huevos, cereales, condimentos, abarrotes etc. el también sale a vender huevos de forma ambulante para obtener mas ingresos. Lo ha surtido poco a poco reinvirtiendo sus ganancias y con inversion de prestamos. El ha decidido solicitar un tercer préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras para surtir de más productos comestibles que le ayuden a incrementar sus ventas y sus ganancias como manteca,huevos, azucar,arroz, refrescos, jabon, frijoles y otros abarrotes. Todo el esfuerzo que hace es para mantener siempre una fuente de ingresos para su familia y hacer que su negocio crezca más para poder tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Elvis is 35 years old and has three children. He lives with his wife and the children in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. Elvis worked in an assembly plant and finding himself unemployed he decided to start his own business by himself and manage it with his wife. He sells basic food basket items like basic grains, lard, eggs, cereals, condiments, groceries, etc. He also goes out in the streets and sells eggs to make more revenue. He has stocked his store little by little, reinvesting his profits and investing his loans.

Elvis has decided to request a third loan of 20,000 HNL to stock more perishable goods like lard, eggs, sugar, rice, soft drinks, soap, beans and other groceries. Which will help him increase his sales and his profits. All his efforts are made to maintain a source of income for his family and increase the size of his business so that he can have his own house.

loans.use: to buy beans, lard, soft drinks, rice, sugar, soap, eggs and other groceries to re-sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Here is 48-year-old Rebecca from Liberia. Precisely, she lives in the area of the Airport community. She is married and has nine children between the ages of 10 and 29; only 5 are attending school and live at home. Her husband is a driver. 

For the past 10 years she has been into a soap, salt, candle, candy, matches, pepper, etc., business in the local market. She enjoys the business because she makes a lot of profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap, salt, candles, candy, matches, peppers, etc., to resell. She hopes to build a house for her children and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, salt, candles, candy, matches, peppers, etc., to resell.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 45-year-old married woman who works at home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for 10 years now, and she is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Irshad was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family; due to limited resources none of their three children was sent to school. Irshad felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards. 

Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele, but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders so she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in various colors. 

She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She wishes to spend part of the profits on providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in various colors.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is from Ozamiz City. She is 47 years old and is married with four chidren. In order to help the family, she engages in food and snack vending. In this year (2013), she joined Paglaum MPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. 

She wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase more raw ingredients for her food and snack vending business. Through this, she hopes to increase her income to be sufficient for her daily needs. She plans to send her children to college so that they can help her in the future, and to repair their house.

Finally, she has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients for her food and snacks vending business.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 44-year-old married woman. She is the mother of six children. She recently started a small general store at her home. She makes a good amount of income to lead her family circle. She is accountable to provide for her family. However, she faces a financial problem in the growth of her business. She needs to buy more items to fill her store. For this purpose, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy more packs of biscuits, grains and cleaning products to meet the demand of her customers time after time. 

She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to buy more packs of biscuits, grains and cleaning products.

loans.name: Rozina

texts.en:
Rozina is a 35-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband sells carpet, which is the only source of income for the family. He purchase carpets from factories and resells them in the main market at a profitable price.

Presently, he needs additional capital for the growth of the business. For that purpose, Rozina is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of carpets to sell. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to respond quickly to customer needs. With the help of the profit amount he will put aside some savings amount to pay for the electricity and gas bill. Rozina hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of carpets to sell.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is 26 years old. She is a married woman and mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Fouzia’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Fouzia has applied for a loan of 45,000 Rs (Pakistani rupees) for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Fouzia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 24-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She has been running a business of clothing sales for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. 

Shumaila requested a loan of 25,000 Rs (Pakistani rupees) from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of different clothes for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business. She is in her second loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy stock of different cloths for the winter season.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 40-year-old lady who lives in the community surrounding Airport. She is married and has six children between 6 and 25. Among her children, only three are in school and living at home. Over the past four years she has been involved with the sales of rice by the cup, pepper, vita, oil, etc., in the local market. She was helped by her aunty to start her business, which she gets some money from. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, vita, oil, etc., for her business. She hopes to build a house and educate all her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, vita, oil, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 31-year-old hardworking man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He operates a motorcycle business, but also practices farming in order to support his family. Unpredictable weather challenges and the high cost of transport are his major challenges, while his dream is to own a taxi and expand his farming activities. Robert intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 21 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de chincha y para poder salir adelante trabaja en una institución como vendedor de tarjetas, lo cual le ha permitido estudiar la carrera de economía, Francisco trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad.

Francisco está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda podrá realizar mejoras en el baño de la vivienda donde vive con sus padres, entre ellas colocar piso, tarrajear paredes, entre otros; asi mejorara su calidad de vida y seguir luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Francisco, 21, lives in the city of Chincha.  To get ahead he works in an institution selling cards, which has allowed him to study economics.  Francisco works about nine hours a day and believes it's going well for him because of his responsibility.

Francisco's grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to make improvements on the bathroom in the house where he lives with his parents.  He'll put in a floor and plaster the walls, among other things.  This way he'll improve his quality of life and continue striving to realize his big dream of having his own house.

loans.use: to improve his bathroom

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is 40 years old married to Joyce and they have two children who are in school.

He has a business of selling cloths in Naivasha which he has operated for four years and has applied for first loan from Kadet ltd to enable him to purchase more cloths to sell. With the anticipated profit, he plans to pay school fees for his children and buy more stock for his business.

He hopes to see his children well educated in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more cloths to sell

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en:
Miraflor is married with 3 children. She is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Miraflor is a farmer and raises pigs and piglets to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. Now she needs a loan to buy piglets and feed for her pigs.  In the future, Miraflor hope to have a big farm.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

location.town: PAgadian - Dao, Pagadian City Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Antonitha

texts.en: Antonitha is 37 years old supporting a family of 7 people.  She has been in this business for the last five years with a monthly income of KES 70,000.  She has managed to get her first loan with KADET LTD of KES 20,000 which she plans to use to purchase more stocks of vegetables for resale. The anticipated profit she will use to improve her family's living standards. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business and build a house on her farm.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael is 28 years old and supporting a family of five.  He has practiced agriculture for the last ten years with a monthly income of KES 20,000.  Raphael has managed to get his 3rd loan from KADET LTD of KES 60,000 which he plans to use to purchase more cows. With the anticipated profit he will buy more sheep and goats.  His hopes and dreams are to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy some cattle

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine earns a living by selling Hopia.  She is 32 years old, married and lives Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga Del Norte. She bakes Hopia and sells it at different places in town. This business is self-sustainable and has become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 5,000 per month.  

Geraldine is seeking a PHP 5,000 loan. She would like to use the loan to purchase other products aside from the ingredients for Hopia. This is a microfinance loan, and will be repaid in a short period of time. This is her first loan with the cooperative. Geraldine is very diligent and loves accuracy which only adds to the effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil and other ingredients to bake Hopia

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Sikoe

texts.en:
Sikoe is 38 years old, married and supports a family of twelve. His children are aged between 3 months and 12 years. He is a livestock trader in Nkareta area and has been running the business for the past four years making a monthly income of KES 40,000
This is his fourth loan of KES 100,000 from KADET which he intends to use to purchase more livestock for resale. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to improve his business. Sikoe's dream is to improve his family's living standard constructing them a permanent home.

loans.use: to buy livestock for trade

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca lives in the Litein area of Kenya. She has 3 children and has been doing this work for 5 years. Her primary income sources are from selling milk, and transportation services.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Farming.' Her biggest challenge is 'Not enough capital to acquire more income generating assets.' Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Rebeca was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Low interest.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Help us acquire income generating assets like a cow.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Rebeca replied 'Improve living conditions.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Rebeca owns the following: 'cow, pump, motorcycle' but does not own 'pig, poultry, bicycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, running water' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

loans.use: To put up a dairy unit.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a married woman who has been blessed with one school going child. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Deborah operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting loan of KES 35,000 to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en: Nino is 44 years old. She is hard working and determined, with a will to get ahead in life. She lives in the capital city, Tbilisi, with her three children. The elder son is a university attendant and the younger children are school aged. Nino's economic activity is a newly started store where fruits and vegetables are sold. Her plan now is to continue to work on her business and to make it grow. Nino applied for the credit from MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of $1900 will help Nino to improve her store and enlarge the quantity of products. She will buy stocks of fruits and vegetables and frozen food as well. With this financial support Nino will expand her store and attract more customers. She promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables and frozen food to enlarge her store

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta is a 38 year old single mother of two children who are in school.

She has a business selling charcoal in Naivasha which she has operated for eight years and has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to purchase stocks of charcoal for sale. With the anticipated profit, she plans to pay school fees and buy more stock for her business.

She hopes to own the biggest charcoal store in Naivasha market.

loans.use: To buy charcoal.

loans.name: Gulsun

texts.ru: Гулсуну 48 лет. Она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Гулсун вместе семьёй живет в отдаленном регионе на севере Таджикистана. Гулсун более 6 лет занимается шитьем занавесок. Она шьет занавески по новым модельям и продает местным жителям. Таким образом, она помогает местным жителям улучшить условию дома и сделать их дом более уютным. Ее дочь помогает ей по введению бизнеса. Гулсун этим ремеслом зарабатывает на жизнь. С полученного дохода она купила швейную машинку марки «Чайка». Кроме того, она выдала замуж свою дочь. Она хочет отремонтировать свой дом, но не имеет достаточно денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Gulsun is 48 years old. She is married and has two children. Gulsun lives with her family in the remote region on the north of Tajikistan. Gulsun has been sewing curtains for over six years. She sews curtains according to new models and sells to the local residents. This way she helps the residents improve their living conditions in their homes and make their homes more comfortable. Her daughter helps her run the business. Gulsun makes a living doing this craft. She has purchased a sewing machine Chaika from the received income. Besides that she has got her daughter married. She wants to repair her house, but does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni to buy building materials such as cement and wood. She is waiting for your kindness and hopes for her generosity.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and wood to repair the house.

loans.name: Bashoratkhon

texts.ru: Башоратхон родилась в 1966 года. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Башоратхон вместе семьей живет счастлива. Она не имеет высшее образование и поэтому старается, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование и стали высококвалифицированными специалистами. Она занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур уже более 3 года. Башоратхон справляется с бизнесом отлично. Ее муж и дети помогают ей по выращиванию сельхоз культур как помидор, красный перец и т.п. Ее сын учится в университете, и она должна оплатить за учебный договор. Башоратхон запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Bashoratkhon was born in 1966. She is married and has three children. Bashoratkhon lives happily with her family. She doe snot have higher education and that why she tries for her children to get higher education and become highly skilled professionals. She cultivates field crops for over three years. Bashoratkhon does her business well. Her husband and children help her in the cultivation of vegetables such as tomatoes, bell peppers and etc. Her son is studying at the university and she has to pay for his tuition. Bashoratkhon is asking for a loan to pay for tuition for her son. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her son.

loans.name: Munisa

texts.ru: Муниса трудолюбивая женщина. Она единственная кормилица своих 2 детей. Ее муж умер, и она осталась вдовой без кормильца. Муниса после смерти мужа в 2009 году поступила на работу в средней школе. Она до сегодняшнего дня работает учительницей младших классов. Муниса постепенно развивает свои педагогические навыки. С целью получения высшего образования она поступила в Педагогический Университет. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор. С такой целью она обратилась за займом. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Munisa is a hardworking woman. She is the only provider for her two children. Her husband has passed away and she became a widow without a provider. Munisa has started working in the secondary school in 2009 after her husband's death. Till this day she is working as a teacher of elementary grades. Munisa is gradually developing her teaching skills. With the goal to get higher education she has enrolled in the Pedagogical University. She has to pay for her tuition. Munisa has come with this goal and is asking for a loan to pay for her tuition. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for tuition at the university.

loans.name: Kikompii

texts.en:
Kikompii is 36 years old and married to Noomejoli. They have five children between the ages of 5 and 16. He learned about Kadet from other livestock herders in his area who are already being funded by Kadet. 

Kikompii rears livestock in the Nkareta area and has been in the livestock business for the last four years, earning a monthly income of KES 19,000. He is servicing his fourth loan of KES 100,000 from KADET, which he plans to use to purchase more livestock for fattening and resale.

Kikompii intends to use the anticipated profits to add to his animals’ numbers and pay the school fees for his children. His dream is to prosper and improve the family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Fotimakhon

texts.ru: Фотимахон умная и начитанная девушка. Она хорошо училась в средней школе и всегда мечтала получить высшее образование и служить своей родине. После окончания средней школы она успешно поступила в Таджикский Технологический Университет. Она учится по специальности программиста. Фотимахон с учебой справляется отлично и старается расширить свой кругозор. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Ее родители простые рабочие и не в состоянии оплатить за ее учебный договор. Фотимахон запрашивает займ на сумму 500 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Fotimakhon is an intelligent and well-read young woman. She did well in secondary school and always dreamed of getting a higher education and serving her country. After graduating from secondary school, she was accepted into Tajikistan Technical University. She is studying to be a programmer. Fotimakhon has done a great job managing her studies and is trying to expand her horizons. She is unmarried and lives with her parents. Her parents are simple blue-collar workers and they are not in the position to pay for her university tuition. Fotimakhon is requesting a loan in the amount of 500 USD to pay for her university tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Nato

texts.en:
Nato is a 43-year-old woman. She lives with her son in a small village in the Samtredia district. Nato is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has a cow. Nato milks the cow every day and produces dairy products. She sells approximately 20 kg of cheese every month. 

In addition, Nato has a plot of land, where nut trees are grown. Nato sells the harvested nuts. As this income is only seasonal, Nato has decided to start her own business. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables her to receive a loan of 300 GEL to start her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she will purchase clothes and then sell them at higher prices. The start-up program will offer great support to her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 30 years old and lives in Margibi County, which is the largest rubber-producing plantation in Liberia. She lives with her husband and children, all of whom are in school and between 4 and 15 years old. 

For eight years now, Mamie has been involved in the red oil business. She was taught how to sell by her uncle's wife. For more than eight years now, she has been selling red oil in the local market. She earns greater profits and gets more popular every day. She is asking for a loan to buy more red oil for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Ashurkhon

texts.ru: Ашурхон 19 лет. Она студентка 2 курса. Ашурхон в колледже учится отлично и успешно в общественной жизни колледжа. В свободное от занятий время, она помогает маме по домохозяйству. Ее отец трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации, а мать работает учительницей в средней школе. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор, но ее отец не отправил деньги, а мать не в состоянии оплатить за ее учебный договор. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ashurkhon is 19 years old. She is a second-year student at university. Ashurkhon is studying really well in college and has a thriving social life there. In her free time when she is not in classes, she helps her mother with chores around the house. Her father is a labor migrant in the Russian Federation and her mother works as a teacher in a secondary school. She needs to pay for her tuition, but her father did not send any money home and her mother is not in the position to pay for her university tuition. She is requesting a loan to pay for her tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her college education.

loans.name: Javoirkhon

texts.ru: Чавоирхон уроженка района Бохтар. Ей 59 лет. Она вдова, имеет троих сыновей, которым по 38, 31 и 25 лет. Старший сын занят в сфере обслуживания, второй сын имеет свой дилерский центр, а третий сын находится на заработках в России. Сама Чавоирхон работает уборщицей в школе, однако ее заработная плата маленькая и не хватает на семейные расходы. Сейчас она хотела бы начать собственный торговый бизнес. Она планирует заняться торговлей тканей и платков. Чавоирхон уже арендовала торговую точку в центре района. Она просит кредит чтобы закупить ткани и женские платки, и начать свой бизнес. Благодаря данному кредиту у нее появится дополнительный источник дохода и ее жизнь намного улучшится.
texts.en: Javoirkhon is a native of the Bohtar district. She is 59 years old. She is a widow and has three sons who are 38, 31, and 25 years old. Her eldest son works in the service industry, her middle son has his own dealership and her youngest son is a labor migrant in Russia. Javoirkhon works as a janitor in a school, however her salary is very small and not enough to cover the family's expenses. Now, she would like to start her own retail business. She plans to sell fabric and dresses. Javoirkhon has already rented a space for her shop in the center of town. She is requesting a loan to buy fabric and women's dresses to start her own business. Thanks to the received credit, she will have an additional source of income and her life will improve greatly.

loans.use: to buy fabric and women's dresses to start her own retail business.

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua is a business woman who is very hardworking.  She is a mother of four school going children.  She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Afua has operated a charcoal selling business for the past ten years.  Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby.  She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Sarinke

texts.en:
Sarinke is 36 years old, married and supports a family of seven members.  He rears and sells livestock in Nkareta area of Narok county, Kenya.  He learnt about Kadet from other livestock farmers in his area who are already being funded by Kadet.  Sarinke has been in the livestock trade for the last four years, earning a monthly income of KES 14,000. 

He is servicing his fourth loan of KES 100,000 from KADET that he plans to use to purchase more livestock for fattening and resale at a gain.
Sarinke intends to use the anticipated profits to add to his animals’ numbers and to cater for the family's basic needs.  His dream is to prosper and improve the family’s living standards

loans.use: to purchase livestock for fattenning and resale

loans.name: Joy's Group

texts.en:
Joy's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Joy is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro, in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past two years, Joy has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food.

To help expand her business, Joy has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. This loan will be used to stock more food for her restaurant to sell, and it will help Joy to generate greater profits and expand her restaurant into a bigger business. Joy hopes that she will be able to buy a plot of land in the future.

Joy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock more food for her restaurant to sell.

loans.name: Nestan

texts.en:
Nestan is a 24-year-old woman.  She lives in a small village of Chiatura district with her mother, brother and two daughters.  Both of her daughters go to the local kindergarten.  Her mother is provided with a retirement pension and her brother does physical labor to get small monthly income. 

Nestan decided to start her own business and requested a loan.  The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of $ 400 for a sales business.  She will start to sell clothes and will be able to increase the income of her family.

loans.use: to begin selling clothing

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf is a 48 year old married man with 3 children living in Fort Portal,Uganda.  He sells clothes and also practices farming in order to earn a living.  Unpredictable customer preferences and high cost of clothes pose a challenge to his business growth while his dream is to own a modern boutique. Yusuf intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 50 years old, lives in Magibi County, which has the largest rubber plantation in Liberia.  She has three children between the ages of 20 to 30 years old.  For the past 30 years she has been involved with the business and she is presently selling rice, peanut, candy, pepper, etc in the market. 

Some of the problem she is facing is fewer goods.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, peanut, candy, pepper, etc. for her business.  Her plans are to expand her business and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, peanut, candy, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Oltimau
